summary:
=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/01/23 Average Rating: 3.7 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Matthew Bonifacio'], 'Producers': ['Stephen Ashkinos', 'Matthew Bonifacio', 'Carmine Famiglietti'], 'Starring': ['Lou Martini Jr.', 'Susan Varon', 'Sharon Angela'], 'Studio': ['FilmBuff']} Review Text: This was listed as being a documentary and so I started it. It's clearly not, and from what I can tell (I only watched 20 minutes it's not that great of a movie. Review Title: Not a Documentary Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/01/28 Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Joe Berlinger', 'Bruce Sinofsky'], 'Producers': ['Joe Berlinger', 'Bruce Sinofsky', 'IFC'], 'Starring': ['Delbert Ward', 'Roscoe Ward', 'Connie Chung']} Review Text: I felt this was well done and true. No need to make a story this one tells itself in the footage alone and does a great job. I think it is easy to understand the peoples emotions in this movie and how they feel about the family. Review Title: Well Done Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/01/28 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Richard Press'], 'Producers': ['Philip Gefter'], 'Starring': ['Bill Cunningham', 'Anna Wintour', 'Tom Wolfe'], 'Studio': ['Zeitgeist Films']} Review Text: I love a good documentary about talented interesting people and this is one of them for sure. You really fall for Bill's simplicity and his talent. What a neat person. Review Title: Love him~ Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Surviving Progress Review Date: 2013/12/03 Store: Margaret Atwood (Actor), Colin Beavan (Actor), Mathieu Roy (Director), Harold Crooks (Director) & 1 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Documentary Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Technological advancement, economic development, population increase - are they signs of a thriving society? Or too much of a good thing? Based on the best-selling book a Short History of Progress, this provocative documentary explores the concept of progress in our modern world, guiding US through a sweeping but detailed survey of the major "progress traps" facing our civilization in the arenas of technology, economics, consumption, and the environment. Featuring powerful arguments from such visionaries as Jane Goodall, Margaret Atwood, Stephen Hawking, Craig Venter, Robert Wright, Michael Hudson, and Ronald Wright, this enlightening and visually spectacular film invites US to contemplate the progress traps that destroyed past civilizations and that lie treacherously embedded in our own. Leading critics of Wall Street, cognitive psychologists, and ecologists lay bare the consequences of progress-as-usual as the film travels around the world - from a burgeoning China to the disappearing rainforest\'s of Brazil to a chimp research lab in New Iberia, Louisiana - to construct a shocking overview of the way our global economic system is eating away at our planet\'s resources and shackling entire populations with poverty. Providing an honest look at the risks and pitfalls of running 21st Century "software" (our accumulated knowledge) on 50,000-year-old "hardware" (our primate brains), Surviving Progress offers a challenge: To prove making apes smarter was not an evolutionary dead end.', 'Review', "MIND-EXPANDING... SUBVERSIVE... BRISTLING WITH PROVOCATIVE INSIGHTS. Both brainy and light on its feet, and with wide variety of involving visuals, this mind-expanding ecological documentary bristles with provocative insights and probing questions about humanity and the state of the world. --Kenneth Turan, LA TimesA who's-who of great thinkers are riveting as they walk us through the question of whether we will or can survive progress. --Ernest Hardy, Seattle WeeklyCRITIC'S CHOICE. EXCELLENT! Succinct and entertaining. Weaves together a vast assortment of materials as well as information, to highly watchable results. Do the earth a favor: see this movie, and drag a skeptic you know along. --Dennis Harvey, San Francisco Bay Guardian"] Average Rating: 3.7 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Special Interests', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Gary Marcus, Daniel Povinelli, Mark Levine, Marina Silva, Kambale Musavuli, David Suzuki, Harold Crooks, Jim Thomas, Mathieu Roy, Michael Hudson, Victor Zhikai Gao, Vaclav Smil, Jane Goodall, Stephen Hawking, Robert Wright, Colin Beavan, Margaret Atwood, Simon JohnsonGary Marcus, Daniel Povinelli, Mark Levine, Marina Silva, Kambale Musavuli, David Suzuki, Harold Crooks, Jim Thomas, Mathieu Roy, Michael Hudson, Victor Zhikai Gao, Vaclav Smil, Jane Goodall, Stephen Hawking, Robert Wright, Colin Beavan, Margaret Atwood, Simon Jo… See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 26 minutes', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '25729809', 'Director': 'Mathieu Roy, Harold Crooks', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 26 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 25, 2012', 'Actors': 'Margaret Atwood, Colin Beavan, Jane Goodall, Stephen Hawking, Michael Hudson', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'First Run Features', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: This one really gets you thinking and inspires change. With a great soundtrack to boot (Philip Glass like) Excellent ~ Review Title: Excellent ~ Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Peppa Pig: My Birthday Party Review Date: 2014/11/16 Store: Rated: NR Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, All Fox Titles Product Description: ['Peppa is a lovable little piggy who lives with her younger brother George, Mummy Pig and Daddy Pig. Peppa loves playing games, dressing up, visiting exciting places and making new friends, but her absolute favorite thing is jumping up and down in muddy puddles!Bonus Content:', 'Disc 1 - Peppa Pig My Birthday Party:', 'Learn the Alphabet', 'Learn the Alphabet', 'Learn to Count', 'Learn to Count'] Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '272270', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Animated, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 20 minutes', 'Release date': 'August 1, 2019', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo)', 'Studio': '20th Century Fox', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: Boring. Review Title: Dull Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: American Girl: Grace Stirs Up Success Review Date: 2015/07/28 Store: Olivia Rodrigo (Actor), Eloise Webb (Actor), Vince Marcello (Director) & 0 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Action & Adventure Product Description: ["Grace has a real talent for baking and a passion for making delicious dreams come true. When her mom announces a trip to visit relatives in Paris, Grace isn't so sure about leaving her friends and their cupcake business. That is, until she discovers she'll get to work with her uncle and cousin in a real French pastry shop! But nothing goes as planned and her attempts to help out end in disaster. With some help from her family and a pup named Bonbon, she turns her vacation around. But when Grace returns home, she discovers her grandparents' bakery is in trouble! With their dreams on the line, can Grace find the winning recipe for success?", 'Bonus Content:', 'Masterchef Junior', 'Masterchef Junior', 'Doggie Day Spa', 'Doggie Day Spa', 'Playing Dress Up', 'Playing Dress Up', ']]>'] Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '33679142', 'Director': 'Vince Marcello', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 42 minutes', 'Release date': 'June 23, 2015', 'Actors': 'Olivia Rodrigo, Eloise Webb, Caitlin Carmichael, Notlim Taylor, Joe Bastianich', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish', 'Producers': 'Debra Martin Chase, Jean A. McKenzie', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Studio': 'Studio Distribution Services', 'Writers': "Jessica O'Toole, Amy Rardin", 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: Very well done. Review Title: American Girl Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: The One I Love Review Date: 2016/06/06 Store: Elisabeth Moss (Actor), Mark Duplass (Actor), Charlie McDowell (Director) & 0 more Rated: R Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Comedy Average Rating: 4.2 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Ted Danson, Charlie McDowell, Mark Duplass, Elisabeth Moss, Mel Eslyn', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 31 minutes'} Review Text: I love this movie and was shocked I didn't hear about it. I love the concept the acting and last but not least the house!!!! The guest house is my dream house. Review Title: Love it!! Frankovich', 'Mike Frankovich'], 'Starring': ['Liv Ullmann', 'Edward Albert', 'Gene Kelly'], 'Studio': ['Columbia Pictures']} Review Text: A 40 year old who looks stunning falling in love with a stunning younger man without all the cheesy gross cougar stuff. No silly plot twist a true love story. 😍

Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: HOCUS POCUS Review Date: 2019/12/02 Store: Bette Midler (Actor), Sarah Jessica Parker (Actor), Kenny Ortega (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Action & Adventure Product Description: ['In Disney\'s HOCUS POCUS, Academy Award(R) nominee Bette Midler (Best Actress, 1991, FOR THE BOYS), stars with Sarah Jessica Parker (SEX AND THE CITY) and Kathy Najimy (THE WEDDING PLANNER) as three wild witches who return from seventeenth-century Salem for a night of zany fun and comic chaos. After they\'re conjured up by unsuspecting pranksters, the tricky trio sets out to cast a spell on the town and reclaim their youth. But first they must outwit three feisty kids determined to foil their scheme! Filled with bewitching laughs and magic, this hilarious film is perfect for the whole family!|Producer David Kirschner came up with the idea for the movie one night while he and his young daughter were sitting outside and his neighbor\'s black cat strayed by. Kirschner began to unspool a narrative of how the cat was once a boy who was changed into a feline 300 years ago by three witches.|Actress Kathy Najimy described her character Mary as "Eddie Haskell as a witch," referring to the character on the classic TV series "Leave It To Beaver." "She sucks up to Winifred [Bette Midler\'s character] every chance she gets. She wants to be part of the power club and Winifred\'s got the power."|To create the costumes, designer Mary Vogt read many historical books about Salem, Massachusetts. "I even read diaries of women who were hanged as witches," she says.'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'ACTION, Comedy, LIVE', 'Format': 'NTSC, Subtitled', 'Contributor': 'Stephanie Faracy, Sean Murray, Sarah Jessica Parker, D.A. Pawley, Bette Midler, Thora Birch, Don Yesso, Neil Cuthbert, Amanda Shepherd, Steve Voboril, Doug Jones, Kathy Najimy, Kathleen Freeman, Kenny Ortega, Tobias Jelinek, Norbert Weisser, Larry Bagby, Karyn Malchus, Vinessa Shaw, Mick Garris, Ezra Sutton, Omri Katz, Charles RocketStephanie Faracy, Sean Murray, Sarah Jessica Parker, D.A. Based on this purchase history, summarize this person's genuine preferences and patterns in under 256 words. Focus only on keywords and clear trends supported by multiple interactions. Do not repeat specific product names or details. Here's the purchase data: === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/01/23 Average Rating: 3.7 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Matthew Bonifacio'], 'Producers': ['Stephen Ashkinos', 'Matthew Bonifacio', 'Carmine Famiglietti'], 'Starring': ['Lou Martini Jr.', 'Susan Varon', 'Sharon Angela'], 'Studio': ['FilmBuff']} Review Text: This was listed as being a documentary and so I started it. It's clearly not, and from what I can tell (I only watched 20 minutes it's not that great of a movie. Review Title: Not a Documentary Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/01/28 Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Joe Berlinger', 'Bruce Sinofsky'], 'Producers': ['Joe Berlinger', 'Bruce Sinofsky', 'IFC'], 'Starring': ['Delbert Ward', 'Roscoe Ward', 'Connie Chung']} Review Text: I felt this was well done and true. No need to make a story this one tells itself in the footage alone and does a great job. I think it is easy to understand the peoples emotions in this movie and how they feel about the family. Review Title: Well Done Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2013/01/28 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Richard Press'], 'Producers': ['Philip Gefter'], 'Starring': ['Bill Cunningham', 'Anna Wintour', 'Tom Wolfe'], 'Studio': ['Zeitgeist Films']} Review Text: I love a good documentary about talented interesting people and this is one of them for sure. You really fall for Bill's simplicity and his talent. What a neat person. Review Title: Love him~ Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Surviving Progress Review Date: 2013/12/03 Store: Margaret Atwood (Actor), Colin Beavan (Actor), Mathieu Roy (Director), Harold Crooks (Director) & 1 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Documentary Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Technological advancement, economic development, population increase - are they signs of a thriving society? Or too much of a good thing? Based on the best-selling book a Short History of Progress, this provocative documentary explores the concept of progress in our modern world, guiding US through a sweeping but detailed survey of the major "progress traps" facing our civilization in the arenas of technology, economics, consumption, and the environment. Featuring powerful arguments from such visionaries as Jane Goodall, Margaret Atwood, Stephen Hawking, Craig Venter, Robert Wright, Michael Hudson, and Ronald Wright, this enlightening and visually spectacular film invites US to contemplate the progress traps that destroyed past civilizations and that lie treacherously embedded in our own. Leading critics of Wall Street, cognitive psychologists, and ecologists lay bare the consequences of progress-as-usual as the film travels around the world - from a burgeoning China to the disappearing rainforest\'s of Brazil to a chimp research lab in New Iberia, Louisiana - to construct a shocking overview of the way our global economic system is eating away at our planet\'s resources and shackling entire populations with poverty. Providing an honest look at the risks and pitfalls of running 21st Century "software" (our accumulated knowledge) on 50,000-year-old "hardware" (our primate brains), Surviving Progress offers a challenge: To prove making apes smarter was not an evolutionary dead end.', 'Review', "MIND-EXPANDING... SUBVERSIVE... BRISTLING WITH PROVOCATIVE INSIGHTS. Both brainy and light on its feet, and with wide variety of involving visuals, this mind-expanding ecological documentary bristles with provocative insights and probing questions about humanity and the state of the world. --Kenneth Turan, LA TimesA who's-who of great thinkers are riveting as they walk us through the question of whether we will or can survive progress. --Ernest Hardy, Seattle WeeklyCRITIC'S CHOICE. EXCELLENT! Succinct and entertaining. Weaves together a vast assortment of materials as well as information, to highly watchable results. Do the earth a favor: see this movie, and drag a skeptic you know along. --Dennis Harvey, San Francisco Bay Guardian"] Average Rating: 3.7 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Special Interests', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Gary Marcus, Daniel Povinelli, Mark Levine, Marina Silva, Kambale Musavuli, David Suzuki, Harold Crooks, Jim Thomas, Mathieu Roy, Michael Hudson, Victor Zhikai Gao, Vaclav Smil, Jane Goodall, Stephen Hawking, Robert Wright, Colin Beavan, Margaret Atwood, Simon JohnsonGary Marcus, Daniel Povinelli, Mark Levine, Marina Silva, Kambale Musavuli, David Suzuki, Harold Crooks, Jim Thomas, Mathieu Roy, Michael Hudson, Victor Zhikai Gao, Vaclav Smil, Jane Goodall, Stephen Hawking, Robert Wright, Colin Beavan, Margaret Atwood, Simon Jo… See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 26 minutes', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '25729809', 'Director': 'Mathieu Roy, Harold Crooks', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 26 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 25, 2012', 'Actors': 'Margaret Atwood, Colin Beavan, Jane Goodall, Stephen Hawking, Michael Hudson', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'First Run Features', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: This one really gets you thinking and inspires change. With a great soundtrack to boot (Philip Glass like) Excellent ~ Review Title: Excellent ~ Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Peppa Pig: My Birthday Party Review Date: 2014/11/16 Store: Rated: NR Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, All Fox Titles Product Description: ['Peppa is a lovable little piggy who lives with her younger brother George, Mummy Pig and Daddy Pig. Peppa loves playing games, dressing up, visiting exciting places and making new friends, but her absolute favorite thing is jumping up and down in muddy puddles!Bonus Content:', 'Disc 1 - Peppa Pig My Birthday Party:', 'Learn the Alphabet', 'Learn the Alphabet', 'Learn to Count', 'Learn to Count'] Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '272270', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Animated, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 20 minutes', 'Release date': 'August 1, 2019', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo)', 'Studio': '20th Century Fox', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: Boring. Review Title: Dull Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: American Girl: Grace Stirs Up Success Review Date: 2015/07/28 Store: Olivia Rodrigo (Actor), Eloise Webb (Actor), Vince Marcello (Director) & 0 more Rated: NR Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Action & Adventure Product Description: ["Grace has a real talent for baking and a passion for making delicious dreams come true. When her mom announces a trip to visit relatives in Paris, Grace isn't so sure about leaving her friends and their cupcake business. That is, until she discovers she'll get to work with her uncle and cousin in a real French pastry shop! But nothing goes as planned and her attempts to help out end in disaster. With some help from her family and a pup named Bonbon, she turns her vacation around. But when Grace returns home, she discovers her grandparents' bakery is in trouble! raw_response:
**Preferences and Patterns Summary:**

1. **Documentary Enthusiast:** Regular purchases of documentaries emphasize a strong interest in real-life stories, societal issues, and human emotions. Preference for well-regarded documentaries over fictional content.

2. **Mixed Ratings:** Displays varied ratings for films, showing a tendency to critically assess entertainment value and emotional impact. Ratings ranging from 2.0 (disappointment) to 5.0 (excitement) reflect discerning tastes.

3. **Classic and Powerful Themes:** Shows a liking for classic and impactful narratives, especially those that resonate emotionally or reflect cultural significance.

4. **Family-Friendly Media:** Engages with content for younger audiences; purchases include family animations but ratings suggest selective enjoyment.

5. **Influence of Cast and Theme:** Review comments indicate that the choice of actors and the film's conceptual take influence satisfaction levels.

6. **Introspection and Inspiration:** Several reviews imply that the viewer appreciates films that provoke thought and inspire reflection on personal and societal issues.

7. **Diverse Genre Interest:** Interest spans various genres including drama, comedy, and special interest, suggesting a broad appreciation for storytelling styles. 

Overall, this person is an avid viewer with a clear taste for engaging narratives, particularly in documentaries, while also balancing family-friendly options and classics.

target_interaction.title: Come on its 2020 no more dvd's
target_interaction.text: How is this movie only available on DVD I don't even own a DVD player anymore.
description: Meryl Streep delivers an outstanding performance in director Mike Nichols' acclaimed bio drama of Karen Silkwood, a worker at an Oklahoma nuclear fuel production facility who was exposed to dangerous levels of radiation in the mid-1970s. Karen found her investigation and attempts to expose unsafe conditions at the plant putting her life in jeopardy. Kurt Russell, Cher, Craig T. Nelson, Fred Ward, Ron Silver co-star in this gripping true story. 131 min. Widescreen; Soundtrack: English; Subtitles: English; interview; theatrical trailers; TV spots.
target_interaction.store: Meryl Streep  (Actor),     Kurt Russell  (Actor),     Mike Nichols  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: Blu-ray
